column1: (2010 වසේර් ඡ්නෙහිමි  ශා ේේඛණ  1 ව 15 ේලස සලකුණු කා  ේේ
සාඟ ඉදිරිත්ව කා  ිටිනමි.)”1

column2: In  1V15,  the  names  of  all  three  parties  (i.e.  the  petitioner  and

column1: the two respondents) are there2.
The  2nd
column2:
respondent 
in  his  affidavit  dated  26.07.2012  has

column1: confirmed what has been stated by the 1st respondent.
The title to the temple or the Viharadhipathyship of the temple is
irrelevant to these proceedings.
Both  parties  have  tendered  a  large  number  of  documents  to

column2: prove  possession.    I  think  there  is  necessity  to  scrutinise  those

column1: documents
column2: in  view  of  the  above  admission  made  by  the  1st

column1: respondent.

column2: After  the  inquiry  concluded  by  way  of  written  submissions,  the

column1: learned  Magistrate  in  his  order  dated  20.12.2012  has  “refused
the  facts  stated  in  the  plaint  on  the  ground  that  they  have  not
been established” and decided “to give possession of the property
to the 1st and 2nd respondents”. It reads as follows:
“ඒ  අනුව  ේාා   ඩුේේ  තැමිණිලිකාශ   ේතො තුරු  ෙැනුේ  ේේන ශ  ව
ේවශමි්න
අිපකා ණ ට තාවුරු ේ ොකිරීා ාත තැමිණිලිකාශ  ේතො තුරු ෙැනුේ
ේේන ශේ  තැමිණිේේේ සඳා්න කාරුණු ප්‍රිතක්ේපත ේකාොට ිශ්පප්‍රභශ
කා මි.
